trans-unit.source: Get data from a file on a compute node
trans-unit.target: Get data from a file on a compute node

trans-unit.source: Get data from a file on a compute node
trans-unit.target: Get data from a file on a compute node

trans-unit.source: Gets the content of the specified task file.
trans-unit.target: Gets the content of the specified task file.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to task files.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to task files.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET or HEAD
trans-unit.target: GET or HEAD

trans-unit.source: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job and {task-id} with the id of the task.
trans-unit.target: Replace {job-id} with the id of the job and {task-id} with the id of the task.

trans-unit.source: Replace {file-path} with the path to the task file that you want to get the contents of.
trans-unit.target: Replace {file-path} with the path to the task file that you want to get the contents of.

trans-unit.source: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that contains the node and {node-id} with the id of the node.
trans-unit.target: Replace {pool-id} with the id of the pool that contains the node and {node-id} with the id of the node.

trans-unit.source: Replace {file-path} with the path to the task file that you want to get the contents of.
trans-unit.target: Replace {file-path} with the path to the task file that you want to get the contents of.

trans-unit.source: The optional ocp-range parameter can be used to specify a range of bytes to return from the file.
trans-unit.target: The optional ocp-range parameter can be used to specify a range of bytes to return from the file.

trans-unit.source: You can use the HEAD method to obtain the properties of the task file without getting the contents of the file.
trans-unit.target: You can use the HEAD method to obtain the properties of the task file without getting the contents of the file.

trans-unit.source: The file properties are returned as HTTP response headers.
trans-unit.target: The file properties are returned as HTTP response headers.

trans-unit.source: The file creation time is returned in the ‘ocp-creation-time’ response header.
trans-unit.target: The file creation time is returned in the ‘ocp-creation-time’ response header.

trans-unit.source: The last modified time of the file is returned in the ‘Last-Modified’ response header.
trans-unit.target: The last modified time of the file is returned in the ‘Last-Modified’ response header.

trans-unit.source: The file size is returned in ‘Content-Length’ response header.
trans-unit.target: The file size is returned in ‘Content-Length’ response header.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: 200.
trans-unit.target: Status code: 200.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The response consists of the contents of the specified file.
trans-unit.target: The response consists of the contents of the specified file.
